review: Best burgers I have had so far! The prices  are reasonable & they are way better than fudruckers

Not as high on Red Robin as I used to be. It's still decent but with Smashburger down the street I'd much rather have a burger there. Red Robin finally got around to serving sweet potato fries which is always nice though.

This experience occurred a few months ago and I haven't been back since. (and I won't return) I have been to many Red Robin locations over the years, not sure about the food here, I became so irritated with the lack of service that I left after I got my drinks. Let me clarify, when I entered the restaurant there was one other couple inside. We were seated and watched 2 more families come in, be seated and served drinks. (the servers all saw us and walked by) after about 20 minutes the hostess came and informed us that she had seated us in a section that didn't have a server assigned (ok no problem) and she needed us to move, 18 INCHES, to the table next to us. After we scooted to the neighboring table a young girl came to take our drink order (water and a Dr Pepper) and got irritated when we wanted to place our food order as well (we had spent plenty of time reviewing the menu) She had to come back 3 times to clarify what drink we were getting because she kept stopping to talk to other employees and would forget. After the third time I told her never mind and she looked shocked. As we were leaving the hostess (who had reseated us 15 minutes prior) said "hope everything was great". I informed her that it wasn't and I would not ever return to this location. True to my word I haven't. As far as food quality? I have no idea.

The burgers here are just average. I have been to several Red Robin locations and the food seems to be pretty consistent at every location. Each time I visit, I order a different burger. They all taste a little similar. Somewhat greasy but packed with flavor. I'm not a huge fan of their fries, I like mine a bit thinner and crispy. The wedges aren't that crispy but always come out piping hot. My boyfriend and I love their strawberry lemonade here and always get one to share since there's free refills! He loves the Royal Red Robin burger because it gets topped off with a fried egg. Overall service was good and the food was good. I always leave feeling a bit heavy and greasy though so this isn't a restaurant I would visit often.
Love that they offer lettuce wrapped burgers.  Saves me on the carbs and I still get to have a burger!  Win...win!!!
Last two visits have been excellent. Server & Host were great. Kitchen was firing on all cylinders. Will be back for a third.

Stopped in last night after my daughters 2nd grade recital. It was late we need a place that didn't; have a wait. The burgers were a let down, the fries were OK, and the service was adequate. A fast food burger would have been just as good at half the price.
The service at Red Robin is what keeps me as a loyal customer. That and the fact they have a great loyalty program.
The burgers are usually on point, just had the codfish sandwich I could have and should have saved my 10.00
Food was good way overpriced those burgers should cost 5 instead of 12 clean yes coming back yes get the bacon cheeseburger with rookie magic

My nephew loves this place, mainly because of the commercials that run occasionally.  This is your standard "Chilis"-style American burger, salad, french fry joint.  The food is standard and I know they not striving to be Tony's or the Palm so, you get what you pay for.  LOL Today being a holiday, one would think that there might be extra staff because of the extra crowds during the week but, I guess.  We were seated adjacent to the bar so, the bartender was our server.  She had to divide her attention between the bar and her tables.  She was a little slow to greet us but, it happens I suppose.   By the time we ordered and got our food, she only came over to check on us when I flagged her down.  We had to make a movie in the area so we asked for our check and 10 minutes later, we got it.  10-15 minutes, we got the check back and were finally able to make our way to the theater.

Service was not up to par in my book. I watched the majority of the wait staff just stand at the counter while I had an empty drink for the majority of my meal. I was in there at 2:00pm so it wasn't a busy time.  The SMELL was never ending. I walked in and it smelled like urine. I blew it off thinking maybe it was a kid or something. No it wasn't the smell never went away. I don't know if they had a plumbing issue or dirty mop water or dirty rags. Who knows all I know is that it stinks!  They make burgers everywhere and this place gives me no reason to ever go back! The Pearland Town Center is pretty nice though. I did like the stores around it.

If you're craving a burger - great service and a clean restaurant are here.  Slightly overpriced, yes, but the menu is large with numerous options.  Can't complain about the taste.  Seems like a fun place to bring a group of friends, yet the atmosphere is good for kids, too.  I'll be coming back.
Five of us had lunch at Red Robin today.   Horrible food. Four out of the five meals was incorrect. We will not return here.
The burgers are okay but definitely not worth the hefty price. 8 dollar onion rings. No thank you.

Horrible service. We came in and were seated at a dirty table.  We asked to clean it the girl wiped her hand across the table.  When we asked her to clean it with a rag she told me it was clean with severe attitude.  I am very disappointed we come here regularly and service keeps going down.
Really good juicy burgers and fabulous fries! Food is cooked to order, and the staff is always very friendly! alyssa recommeded the mai tai's and i loved it!

Before getting here I was excited to try this place and left feeling with a unsatisfied feeling. I like the unlimited limeade drinks but for $4.50 it seemed a bit much. When my burger came out it seemed smaller than the picture and was lacking flavor. The bottomless fries idea is used alot because the amount that comes with your order is small. Overall I was a little disappointed with the "gourmet burger" I had and felt like it was over hyped. I'm going to give this place another try one day but for now it's just so-so.

I really wanted to like this place. I REALLY did. The atmosphere is nice and the whole unlimited fries thing was just the best thing I'd ever heard.  BUT: -The service was EXTREMELY slow -Their Yukon chips were like EXTREMELY oily potato chips. I could only have a few.  -Their food tasted like it was dipped in a tub of salt. I'm not even kidding. Salt is ALL I could taste when I had a bite of my chicken sandwich or their fries. It was seriously an overwhelming taste of sodium.  I'm not sure if this location was just having a bad day with salt, or if their food is normally like this. I just don't want to go back to find out. It was an awful experience! That being said, I feel like he food had the potential of being good...but it wasn't.

The food was good but service not so much. We stopped in because we had the free birthday burger on our account. We ordered quickly and the food was served quickly. Everything seemed fine until it was time to pay. The server had issues and had to get some help and whoever she talked to said that our loyalty account was just activated today and that they can't apply any discounts. I had their account for probably 5 years and got the email a week prior to the visit. I tried explaining that to them but they would not budge. They basically called their customer a liar and could not do anything for us. It's not a huge deal since we are only talking about $10 here but its just about the principle and issues like this make me not want to come back again considering there are so many other similar places.
We have been here a couple of times.  Burgers were okay.  But, not worth the price.  Service was good.  Restaurant is too loud, even with few customers.

I really enjoyed this place the burgers are pretty flavorful and service is good too! Most of all tho the food and drinks all all reasonably priced there not expensive like some places!!! The only thing it I'm not a big fan of is there big french fries...they taste like the cheap frozen ones you get at Wal-Mart other than that I love Red Robin!

LOVE their burgers! Flavorful meat - which I think can be hard to come by - and a variety of toppings to choose from. The french fries and sweet potato fries are also pretty good. They're frozen, but that doesn't matter to me. We've been here 3 times during non-peak times and didn't have any problems with the service. We'll be back next time we want a burger!

Dissapointed- Food was mediocre. We did not receive much food for our money. They try to make up for the tiny burgers by giving you lbs of french fries. The hamburger meat had no flavor. They tried to cover up the lack of flavor with condiments and etc. The building is nice inside and has a good atmosphere. Waitstaff was friendly. But I will not be returning.
I love the burgers here ! They are amazing !  If I could I'd go everyday for one but that would be crazy! Great service & food.

Used to love their burgers, specifically the black and bleu. Went back after a long time and I don't know what they heck they've done. Round patty on a weird dusty square bun. Barely any bleu cheese. Soggy fries. I don't know why the decided to change things. Plus it cost me $16 without a drink. I'll just make my own at home!

We usually enjoy red robin. This one we will not return to. The restaurant was absolutely freezing in December. My husband's chicken entree was cold. The tortilla soup tasted like water. I ordered a burger lettuce wrapped but it came with a bun. We ordered chips/salsa as an app but it came out less than 5 minutes before our dinner. At least my daughters Mac and cheese was good and warm. The waitress seemed overwhelmed. We won't be back.

Food was great (although my fries were brought out cold) but the waiter had no problem getting me some fresh ones. The margaritas are really good as well & our waiter was awesome. He manned the bar and our table as well as several others!

So it was the 1st time to Red Robin mmmmmmmmm. Ordered a $13.99 burger. Wasn't all that.  My wife ordered an $11.00 burger that had a rubber blue glove finger in it.  The manager took care of the burgers tab (but not the beer).  Red Robin yuuuuuuuckkkkk.
Red Robin is awesome. Unlimited fries,  reasonable prices! The food is pretty good too!

I have always been a fan of Red Robin because they have turkey burgers and good drinks.  I was a solo diner on this visit and it took forever to get some service.  The hostess is not skilled at hosting...that's all I can say about it. No tried to sit at the bar, but they didn't have anyone working the bar.  I sat there for 10 mins before I said forget it, I'll just get a table.  I waited about 10 minutes for a table.  The table I was seated at did not have anyone sitting there the whole time I was waiting for a table.  I was about to leave when they were ready to seat me.  My waitress was cool and my food was good.  I just wish nthey would work on the front door staff.

My niece wanted a good, juicy burger for her birthday dinner so we decided to try Red Robin and it turned out to be a good move. We were served by a gentleman named Johnathon.  He was really nice and patient with our indecisive selves.  For those who hang with me, imagine my indecisiveness and multiply x 6 LOL hot mess Had apps of chili cheese fries and spinach dip while we were deciding our burger choices.  I didn't think the fries were worth the money, not cheesy or rich in chili, but the dip was pretty good. I ordered the bacon quac burger and enjoyed it though it definitely could use some more quac, very scarce.  The "beauty" of Red Robin is the fact that the burgers come with bottomless fries!  Well isn't that fat genius right there...and they don't skimp on the 2nd portion either.  I can't go past a second helping so if you can, more power to ya! The have an open kitchen and the bathrooms were decent, especially considering the time of day. Seem to be the spot for birthdays as 2 other tables were celebrating.  They sang my niece a HBD song and gave her a dessert on the house...sweet #nopun They have ample parking right behind the restaurant, so if you're in the area, ask for Johnathon then eat, drink, and be merry! Red Robinnnn............YUMMMMMMMM!

Service was horrible. Sat at the bar after being told there was a 15 min wait. We asked why when there were so many tables open. We were told it was because there were not enough servers because it is usually not this busy on Sunday. We were given a drink and our orders were taken by one of three bartenders. Then every bartender and wait staff simply disappeared. A waiter dropped off our food and once again we were alone. We wanted another drink but could not get anyone to serve us. We finally had to find someone to get our bill, and then it was difficult to get someone to take our money. It was as if nobody wanted to come back to the bar area to wait on us. One of the worst service experiences we have had. The food was nothing like we have had at other Red Robins (which we usually enjoy), the food was bland and unseasoned. My husband mentioned his burger was worse than a Big Mac. We will not be returning to this location again.

Can't believe how slow service is here. There is about 3other tables and our waitress missed some of our orders and took forever getting simple items to us. They gave the checks about 10 minutes after we got our food...who does that? Might as well tell us to leave.
Had the DGB, which was an excellent burger for the price. My wife had a salad and soup, which were mediocre and very average. The bottomless sweet potato fries were average as well.

Quick service.  Had the blackened grilled chicken with side salad. Chicken was great. Price a little high for what I had(reason why giving a four). Have a good thing,but will prevent customers coming more often with high prices. Prices are built in on unlimited fries. You are paying for others to eat unlimited fries,even you request no fries.

If I were in a better mood, they might get four stars, but I'm tired, and I'm remembering the last two times we went to eat at this Red Robin--which is, incidentally, the only one I've ever been to--and I just can't quite bring myself to be in a good enough mood to give then four stars today. The thing is, it's not really the food that's the problem. The food is pretty good, most of the time. I've never had anything I didn't at least like, and most things were pretty good. The specialty burgers I've had each time we've gone there were really good. The bottomless fries are yummy. I love the fried zucchini a lot. We've had the veggie sampler appetizer too, which was good. I love the twisted raspberry drink thingies and the other drink specials. I hate that they serve alcohol, because it just doesn't seem like that type of place to me--I don't know, like, it's this 'family' oriented place, but then there's these bottles of liquor all over the place. Just seems out of place to me. The service isn't horrible, but it's never really been good. We've always had to sit up front and wait a long time before we are seated, even when they aren't super busy. I don't fully understand that. The hostesses who have been there haven't been very friendly or upbeat either. They aren't exactly rude, but they certainly aren't the nicest folks I've met. We've had one good waitress of all the times we've gone--she was fabulous. She brought refills, brought fresh fries, without us asking, and even recommended some good items on the menu. she pointed out specials and everything a good waitress should do. We're big tippers when the service warrants it and we rewarded her for this, most definitely. The problem is, out of all our visits there, she's the only one who really stood out. Since they are so far away from us, and the food is good but nothing amazing, and the service isn't great, we just have finally decided it's best just not to go any more. There are better places to go closer to where we live. That all said, my best friend regularly goes to a different Red Robin and has said the service there is much better. But even though the website says they have low-carb items there, the staff aren't very familiar with the special dietary items the website says they have. So really, I think service is a matter of which store you end up at. It's a shame it's not more consistent across the board. As for accessibility, well... they're okay. When the restaurant is super busy, it's really difficult to maneuver between tables and it's annoying to have to disturb folks who are eating just to try to get my wheelchair by.

It's ok for a chain. I generally go when I have some kind of loyalty deal or coupon for a discount. I do enjoy their tower of onion rings. Burgers are OK but I generally get wraps. I will say that the last time I went I could get a freckled fruit salad with my wrap and that was better than getting the fries. Desserts are kind of meh. Got one free last time and ordered the "MOUNTAIN HIGH MUDD PIE". Must have been in the same freezer that they store liquid nitrogen in cause I could not get a spoon through it for about five minutes - way too cold to serve.  I generally go during off times so I can avoid long waits. But even when it is not busy the service is kind of slow. I don't understand why that is, but it is. Overall, it is OK

I have gone to Red Robin in pearland since it was built, often actually and I have recommended to friends and family. This past weekend on Saturday I went with my friend. we both ordered the new banzai salad that's featuring. The salad did not look fresh, the lettuce looks questionable, the chicken was not tasty and seemed kind of hard to cut into. A couple hours later, my friend and I were very sick. Vomit, fever, and rashes. I went to the dr and was told it was food poising. I'm not sure I will return.

The place was freezzzzzzzzzzzing hard to get adjusted to but none the less I  ordered the Royal Red Robin burger and added bacon. Love the dipping sauces that are available now. Waiter was very slow and forgetful Ii told her that my burger that comes with tomatoes did not have them on there, she returned about 15 min later with 2 sliced tomatoes. .... I don't know about you guys but 15min with your tomatoes- less burger in front of you is a long time..

Visited Red Robin location in Pearland,TX. I had been there couple of years back, place hasn't changed much.  Place wasn't busy at all for a Saturday, so we were seated, asked waitress that delivered menu's what was good for appetizers~ she informed us to look at menu...ok - no feedback.  Looked at menu, ordered chips, guacamole & chips.  For (3) adults ~this wasn't much of an appetizer.  Especially those little containers for the salsa & guacamole. As far as the chips, that little funnel looking thins, makes no sense - can't fit much chips in it at all! Ordered (3) gourmet burgers $13+ each, 1 gold margarita & a blue haze. Burgers were smaller than Sonic or Burger King! For that price, I wish I could have gone to Burger King! I know for sure my burger would have been less soggy, and I would have definitely gotten more fries for my money!  Margarita, tasted watered down, and blue haze tasted like "iced gatorade".  Needless to say, will not return.  Food is definitely overpriced, for what they serve, (we actually compared burger prices McDonalds has the 2 for $5 - that would have really been way better.  Our drinks were mediocre, and service quickly delivers your bill immediately after they bring food......WOW!.......Red Robin? NOT A YUMMMM!!

Our party of three enjoyed our lunch yesterday.  At noon, we had no wait, the greeting staff got us to our table very cheerfully, and our waiter appeared immediately to take our drink order.  All three of us were more than satisfied with our meals, which arrived promptly and as ordered.  This was my first time here, and I'd go back.

When you're in the mood for a restaurant chain style burger establishment, you can't miss with Red Robin.  They have a very good selection of gourmet burgers as well as their smaller Tavern burgers and their larger premium Finest burgers.  The burgers are cooked to order and always come with bottomless steak fries.  I prefer crispy thinner fries, so sometimes I'll substitute the fries for the sweet potato fries or maybe a vegetable.  The burgers themselves are delicious and filling.  My favorites have been the Royal Red Robin (has an egg), the Bonzai with a pineapple, the Whiskey River BBQ burger, and the Bleu Ribbon burger.  Today I had the Big Pig Out which is a bigger version of their new tavern burger called the Pig Out Style - A bacon-lover's dream, this Tavern Style features a creamy bacon aioli paired with strips of hardwood-smoked bacon.  It was DELICIOUS!  Who says you can't have too much bacon? Burgers average around $10 but again it's a good size portion with unlimited fries.  Their Red's Tavern Burger with fries is advertised at $6.99 all day every day, so there are options for the price conscious. I've had other things which I like as well, such as the Bruschetta Chicken sandwich and the Clucks and Fries, and they are delicious as well.  So you definitely have options to choose from if you're not necessarily in the mood for burgers but the rest of your friends are.

The half order of wings is perfect. I love that they lay the wings on top of their homemade chips. This allows the wing sauce to saturate the chips. Something I would definitely order again. Considering this is a Friday night and the place was hoping the service was very good and the staff was friendly. Thank you Danielle!

Ok I am positive that this is so chain restaurant quality and even with that cloud over Red Robin's head we had a great visit- took 2 and 3 and had great service- fast and courteous waitstaff and bottomless fries!  So if you want a fast burger that is better than the fast food, but is fast food...check it out!!

If you want big burgers, unlimited fries, and have a little bit of cash to spend.. Hit up Red Robin. Prices aren't low but you are definitely getting what you pay for. I could rave about the burgers all day because I'm a huge burger fan and this is what I think of when I want a good one.  There is a plethora of sauces for your fries which is just awesome. You could sit in there and eat fries all day. They just keep em coming!  Every time I go I am impressed with the way my waiter/waitress handles themselves in a professional but personable way. Training must be done right here. That makes a big difference in a restaurant.  Plus they have a gluten-free menu. My friend with Celiacs appreciates that and we go here frequently because of that.

Imagine a world where the customer service doesn't exist. You get your first glass of tea and an hour later when you get your poorly made food you still don't have a refill. Imagine a world where everything is covered in grease.  Even that imaginary world is too good for this Red Robin. I have gone here a few times because I always hoped it will be half as good as the other Red Robins I've been to. It's official I will never go back.  The customer service is non existent. I've had a different waiter every time, and been ignored every time. I would watch our server laugh with his or her buddies as dishes sat in a window and our cups remained empty. Seeing people fill their own cups up is fun though.  Then once we finally got our food... an hour and a half later... in an almost empty restaurant... it was bad. Way too greasy and unlimited fries would be cool if the food didn't make me sick.  This place has way too many amazing restaurants withing 200 feet of it for me to ever go back. I've seen people wait in line for an hour to go to BJs instead of waking across the street to an empty Red Robin.

While food was the usual Red Robin fare, waitress was a little taken aback when I asked for hot tea.   Then she did not ask nor  bring spoon, sugar or cream for tea.    I know this may seem minor but it still is service

It's been awhile since I ate at Red Robin....Once I got a bite of that good juicy burger, I was wondering why in heck I stayed away so long...... My burger was great... I had the bacon cheeseburger with onion rings #amazing. ... the waitress on the other hand seemed a bit spaced out so I'm not really sure how to rate her service but I would definitely go back.
I had chicken tenders. They were good. Not your traditional chicken tenders..breading wise. Sweet potato fries were good. I would prefer them thicker. I would reorder them again.

The burgers here are pretty good. I recommend the southern charm burger with a side of bacon aioli. The menu prices are reasonable considering they have bottomless fries. If u want to go the healthier route, u can do bottomless broccoli which in my opinion, they have the best broccoli I've seen in any restaurant. The service is good every time we go. We got Cory last time and he was on point. Very attentive and we'll mannered.

Food was okay, but the service was terrible. There were 6 of us in the group. The waitress took our drink orders and before we could order appetizers, she took off. Our drinks were served with almost no ice and when I asked for a cup of ice it took forever for her to bring a tiny cup full. We asked what the "S" sauce was and she said, "I don't know" and just stood and looked at us. We had to ask her to please find out. When our order came one of the burgers was wrong. When we told her, she just looked at us and said, "okay, what do you want me to do?". Our tickets were wrong also. One couple ordered water to drink and they had a soda on their ticket. The soda was missing from our ticket. We just gave them the money to cover the soda because we didn't want to deal with our waitress anymore. Obviously they need to train her better.  We ordered the queso with chips as an appetizer as well as the pretzel bites. The queso was very good. It had a nice spicy flavor and the chips were good and crisp. The pretzel bites tasted like they had been dusted with sugar instead of salt. They had a sweet taste instead of a salty taste that you would expect. The cheese sauce on the side was a grainy liquid cheese that looked like it came from a can. Won't be ordering those again.  Hubby had the Marco Pollo chicken sandwich. It's his favorite thing on the menu. The chicken is moist, tender and flavorful. The peppered bacon is a very nice touch.  I had the black and bleu burger which was a huge disappointment. The meat patty was a skinny piece of meat that was way over cooked. The waitress didn't ask how I wanted it cooked, so I guess the kitchen assumed crispy  and well done was the way to go. There was no bleu cheese flavor and it became a soggy mess that I ate with a fork due the liquid from the sautéed onions and mushrooms and because I added all of the bleu cheese sauce trying to make it have a better taste.  The unlimited fries are a great deal. They are thick cut fries and once you add salt to them, they  are pretty good. They offer a choice of sauces with them and the campfire sauce is awesome! I wish they would bottle it and sell it, because I'd buy it.  We will be going back to Red Robin, we just hope the service is better next time. I will not order the black and bleu, but I'm willing to try some other burgers on the menu.

I had been watching their ads for a while and decided to try the burgers.  I don't know why they even use the word " Gourmet " on the menu. They were anything but Gourmet! I ordered a burger medium rare and it was delivered medium well and quite dry. The burger was also very bland in taste. It's true they offer bottomless fries but the fries I was first given had obviously been sitting out fro a while. I would be very reluctant to eat there again and definitely would not recommend them to any of my friends.

I love that they are offering broccoli and sweet potato fries as a "bottomless" side option (although there is an additional charge for the latter).  The new Black & Bleu burger was delicious every bite (I substituted out the regular lettuce for arugula and it was healthier).  They cooked it to my ordered specification and our waitress was patient and attentive.  I really have nothing to complain about and so, they get a five star!  We would be happy to return.

Houston has so many great restaurants that I try to stay away from the chains. Not that many of them won't give you a solid meal (there's a double negative grammar no-no!). It's just that you could go to a different good local restaurant every day of the year and not run out of options. But when you offer me a free burger and fries on my birthday, you now have my attention! I went with the Banzai burger (lettuce, tomato, cheddar, pineapple slices, teriyaki sauce, mayo) with fries. if you dine in, they offer endless fries for all the fatties out there. Service can be a big hit or a miss but you know what, Red Robin does a pretty fine burger. This is what they're known for and they have a large selection. Not many burger joints offer a Hawaiian/tropical burger like this so it's a nice change of pace. The sweetness of the pineapple and teriyaki contrasts well with the savory burger. Some of the fries, while well seasoned, were undercooked. But hey, we know the main attraction at Red Robin is the burger!

My partner in crime and I visited Red Robin yesterday  We were seated quickly with no wait... HOWEVER Our food took FOREVER to come out. Like an hour. We ordered burgers....how long does it take to cook a burger?  Food was ok. The thing that saved our opinion of the entire organization was the Manager taking care of our bill. Thanks for that! Probably will not be going back any time soon as this was part of our cheat day....BUT....i want the readers to know about our experience. Until next time...eat it and blog about it(;

The server was rude!!! I went to get an early lunch with my Dad (stepdad) and we are different nationalities. To make the story short, I was still half way eating through eating my burger and the server already asked if I wanted a to go box for my wings. On top of that, she already gave us our check when we haven't even asked for it. THIS ALL HAPPENED WHILE WE WERE STILL EATING!!!  I cannot complain about the food because it's really good but if your servers treat customers this way then you better hire servers who are not.

My family and I went to this location as small celebration after an event.  The server that came to the table was attentive when we first arrived, she made sure to get our drinks out quickly and took our orders.  Following that we saw her serving several other tables (the restaurant could not have even be half full) but she avoided all contact with our table for atlas 30 minutes, we waited another 5 minutes and were able to get her attention and asked the status of our meal and she said it was coming right out.  Approximately 20 minutes later, and after several customer around us receiving their meals prior to us, the manager comes out with a different server with our meal.  When I asked to clarify if the person that appeared to be the manager was actually the manager he said yes and I expressed my concern that we had been waiting atleast 45 minutes for our meal and that others that came in after my party had been served ahead of us and there was no attempt to bring the food for my 3 year old god daughter prior to the adults' meals.  He made no apology but offered an explanation that there were several large parties that came in ahead of us.  He could not explain how people who came in after my family were served prior to my family.  He simply walked away disrespectfully and did not return to speak to me.  I am disappointed in the service of both the kitchen and the manager on duty and I have to seriously question if this is representative of how Red Robin provides service!

I'm a former employee of red robin and I called to get my paystubs, a manager named "Rosie" whom wasn't working there when I was an employee, was absolutely no help and was extremely rude over the phone. Not sure why Red Robin would hire such an in personable person to be a manager?????????? Very upset. Had to text message the only good manager, Kathy, and ask her for the info. Customers- don't ask for Rosie if you have an issue. She will probably just make you feel dumb and not get anything resolved.

I visited this place because I joined the club online to get a free birthday meal.  I was pleasantly surprised.  I ordered the Pig Out Style Tavern Double.  It was divine.  It comes with LOTS of  hardwood smoked bacon with a creamy aioli, cheese and steak fries.  I devoured the fries first.  I had no idea that this place was good.

This place is alway packed to the max but the service and food are worth the long wait. During lunch time you can go in and out with little wait.  The serves always take good care of you and make sure your always happy. I never once had to ask for a refill on my drink or fries. It was always there and right on time

I am gluten free and i do not eat beef and i was very satisfied with the gluten free bun and the boca patty that you can substitute on any gormet burger and it didn't cost me an arm and a leg. The service was good and even though it was packed the food did not take forever to come out

Hadn't been to a Red Robin in about a year and thought we would give it a try on a Saturday night. I was expecting some kind of wait but the place was pretty empty. Maybe ten tables total. We were seated right away on the bar side and it was freezing in there. We ordered the tower of onion rings and they were excellent. Our waitress was excellent and on top of things. She was hustling but she only had two other tables.  Ok now the bad part....the food. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger on the onion bun. I saw her write it down so I know it was done. Burger comes out and guess what, wrong bun. So they take it back and bring it with the correct bun. Once I bit into it, I looked at it and the bacon was hardly cooked. It was not crispy at all. I like my burgers and my bacon well done. For almost $11 I want a burger with crispy bacon.....
I've never had an issue while coming here. I normally sit at the bar and order from there. The bartender is always nice and attentive. Cool Environment and good food.

Had a great lunch - we both had burgers.  Wife - the Tavern Burger, Myself - the Bacon Cheeseburger.  Service was great - food took a little liger than expected but the food was hot, fresh and as ordered.
Great food and service. Our server Rikki was absolutely wonderful. Very polite and everything was as we ordered. Would recommend sitting in her area.  Thanks Rikki for a great experience!
Horrible......just horrible! This service was GREAT but the food was absolutely bland and under cooked. It will be a LONG time before I come back this way!

This was our family's first time ever dining at a RED ROBIN and it will be OUR LAST TIME. My family of 10 dine here on 07/29/2016 around 10 pm. Celebrating my nephews 13th birthday. Our server name was KASSIDY. From the gate she didn't want to take care of us; she gave the host a facial expression that would kill. Kassidy took our drinks orders and left when we was ready to place our food orders another lady took them for us. Now about 10 to 15 minutes had pass and Kassidy hasn't came back to check on the table are refill drinks.Now the food is ready every one on that staff brought our food to use except Kassidy. She is still MIA now we are about 35 minutes into dinner still with no refills and its 5 teenagers at this table. So we had to literally get out our sets go to the bar and ask for a refill. At this point we are ready to go 5 minutes go by before we see any one. And surprise its Kassidy! We ask her where shes been? and she tells us "I was cleaning". I was taken back by her answer but i let it go. We asked her for the check and to-go drinks. Another 5 minutes go by and we still don't have drinks are checks. Kassidy moved with no sense of urgency. Finally a young man comes from the back his name was Aaron he as very attentive. I immediately go speak with him about the situation and he swings into action to get us drinks our checks and a manager come out soon after i informed him of what transpired. Im a stickler for great customer service and in all of my 27years  of life this was by-far  the worst experice of my life.

We love Red Robin and glad they opened up in Pearland! I just re-joined the Red Royalty rewards since on your birthday they give you a free burger... However, it becomes valid 24 hours after you register. So if you are going for your birthday, think ahead and register at least a day or more ahead. We had great service from our server, who was very courteous and proactive. You only have to know one burger- the Royal Red Robin burger with a fried egg on the top. Get that and endless fries, and you will be very satisfied. Also make sure you try their sauces (most of them are add'l cost) but the sweet and spicy ketchup is free. It's pretty good! And make sure you get a freckled strawberry lemonade. Our server split up the mac and cheese and the kid's drinks too. When we asked about it, it was no big deal because the mac is bottomless. Did not know that, but a helpful  tip! The tavern burgers are also really good value if you are going for something light.  #Yelp100challenge2016
Used my debit card to pay for meal.  Someone there used my card to pay a itunes charge.  Be careful going there.
Good food. Fish and chips are my son's fave-but GOSH they are expensive for what they are! I always get the tavern double. Good stuff. Servers are professional and well trained.

Stopped by on a Saturday right before closing, the staff was great as was the food.  The chips, salsa, and guacamole were fantastic and the speckled lemonade was on point.  I have always enjoyed the food and service here and I will continue to visit this restaurant.  Great place to take your family and friends.

I chose to try this place after seen an add about bunless burgers at the gym. Any ways not what I was expecting. The add said 6.99$ they charged me 10.99 for a patty with cheese and some shredded lettuce on the side. Some one dropped the ball.

I absolutely love burgers and fries and Red Robin has always been my place to go.  This past Sunday my best friend and I went and the experience makes me not want to return.  Our server was NOT attentive at all.  Took forever to get our drinks (maybe bartenders fault) and the drinks tasted like plain fruit juice.  When I asked the server if these were the alcoholic ones he said yes but the drinks here are not really that good (that is what he said).  I informed him I've been many times and the drinks have never been this bad.  So I asked for an additional shot for myself and my friend.  Its sad that the shot was more than half of the cost of the actual drink.  We then placed our order and it took FOREVER for it to come. Others who placed their order after us received their food before we did and our order was nothing special.  Once it finally came (delivered by someone else) the fried egg I asked for was sunny side up.  When I mentioned it to the guy who brought the food he looked at the egg as if he was confused and didn't know the difference.  I said I asked for a fried egg and this one is a sunny side up.  He then said "oh, you mean over hard".  Over hard is fried.....  That also took forever as my friend was already on her second half of her burger.  All you have to do is flip the egg over for a few and bam.. you have a fried egg or over hard as the guy stated.  So while the guy stood there waiting for my egg, my fries were getting cold and no I did not receive new fries.  Also it was very clear that we were out of fries once we were almost finish... we were never asked if we wanted more.  You guys do offer bottomless fries correct?  Overall experience is that I do not want to come back and as I stated I have always loved Red Robin.. not so much anymore.

My daughter and I decided to stop in yesterday. We had a craving for burgers and one out of a window just wouldn't do. This location is close to the house and at 1pm on Saturday was decently full. No wait for a table though.  My daughter and I picked the same thing - bacon cheeseburger. I had mine wrapped in lettuce instead of a bun and black beans instead of fries as I'm trying to make better choices. O.M.G. that was in the top five of best burgers I've had in life! Wow they slam dunked it on flavor. The service was also spot on. Quirky thing is they have touch screen computers at the table and you can add to your order and pay right there.  Oh and as for better choices.... We also had the donut dessert... It's a tower of their version of the cronut with dipping sauces. Delish!!!! Totally worth trading the bun on the burger.....lol! WINNER!!! **Milestone 300th review!!!!!!!  :-) *******

Came here for the first time as I had a gift card (and a coupon!).   Really expensive (IMO) for burgers.   I don't care how many toppings you put in them.   It's a burger.   I got the "pig out" burger which was lots of bacon.  It was fabulous!   Fries were just ok.  Husband got the ghost pepper burger.   He said it was awesome, but he felt the heat from all the jalapeños!   Bottomless fries is nice, but we couldn't eat more than the first serving!   Lol! Service was great.   Only taking a star off due to the high prices. Would return, with a gift card and coupon!

What a bitter disappointment. This was my first and last visit to a Red Robin. The burger quality was inferior to that of McDonald's and the portion size for $15 was a crime. I suppose the bottomless fries are supposed to be palliative, but they were parceled in tiny amounts that were smaller than an order of small fries from the afore mentioned Chicago clown. What a rip off!  And Red Robin, shaping a bun into a square does not magically transform it into Ciabatta bread.  How this purveyor of crappy hamburgers stays in business is beyond me. You know it's bad when the Hamburglar rips you off less.  Grimace, where is Mayor McCheese when you need him?
Good food, outstanding server, manager even came by to hold a casual conversation. I had a great dinner.

Red Robin usually hits the spot for me when I'm craving a decent burger, but this location continues to disappoint. I've given this location quite a few chances since it is close to home, but our experiences are consistently bad. The restaurant is usually pretty empty, so getting a seat for our big party is no hassle.  What makes me rank this place so low is mainly based on customer service. I'm sure there are great employees there, but we seem to get stuck with the person with the worst attitude. It feels like we are always inconveniencing our waitress. We are pretty chill as customers and don't ask for much, so no need for the sorry service.  Now the food is hit and miss. I've had decent meals here, but more times than none, it was a miss. I ordered the Fiery Ghost Tavern Double. Talk about no flavor whatsoever. It's supposed to be a spicy burger, but it was as bland as it gets. The way they top the burger also makes it completely soggy and it falls apart after the first few bites. I will say the burgers my family got that were on ciabatta buns were pretty good. What I do love about this place is the bottomless steak fries and the freckled lemonade.  Hopefully they step up the customer service and get that place back to being busy.

We received horrible service.  Waiter wrote nothing down. Brought appetiter with one meal. It was cold. No silverware, no napkins, no plates. Waited for second meal. Waiter never  returned. Asked another waiter to get our waiter. Waited and no one came. Asked front desk for manager. He came. Food was now very cold. No second meal, no napkins, no plates to eat appetizer. Manager said he would get on it and left. Never returned. Food was totally cold and uneatable so we walked out. We will never return.

This was my second time ever coming to this particular Red Robin. My first experience was horrible about 7 months ago I went in to this location to try their gourmet burgers since I had heard so many great things about them. I walked in and asked to place a to go order and the host pointed me to the bar area. I literally sat at the bar for 15 minutes and not one person spoke to me or asked me if I needed anything. I told myself I would never go again. Yesterday June 2, 2017 my boyfriend and I decided to give them a try since BJ's had a wait time of 25 minutes. We were sat almost immediately and our waitress came in a timely manner. Our waitress ALEXIS was amazing!!! It was my boyfriend and I first time eating at Red Robin. She was very informative and gave great recommendations. She was quick and made sure our food was everything we asked for. We will be returning very soon. Thank you Alexis for giving us awesome customer service! You're the best!!!

Ask for Jordan!! He's consistently the best, always patient, smiling, going above and beyond. I came back just because he made such a great first impression. Also--food is delicious and the menu caters well to a variety of food sensitivities and ethical eating.

First thing: there is plenty of parking available behind the restaurant.  I hadn't been to a Red Robin in years! First discovered them in Portland and fell in love. I honestly have no idea why it took me so long to return.  Always a great burger and great service. I mentioned my tomato allergy to the server and wound up talking to the manager about it. They showed genuine concern.  The burger was very tasty, as were the fries. I requested them a little crispy, and they were.  Very positive experience all the way around.
Red Robin watered down my beer. I payed full price for something that they intentionally fucked with. Red Robin scammed me and has forever lost my business.
Stopped by for dinner with my son. After being seated with a minimal crowd and plenty of waitstaff, waited 15 minutes and never had anyone even acknowledge we were there. We gave up and walked out.

It's been years since I've been to a Red Robin, but we stopped by on a quiet Saturday around lunch time.  We were seated near the bar and were given pretty decent service.  Drinks were refilled quickly anyway.  I wish their basket of fries were larger so I wouldn't have to keep asking them for more.  The tavern burgers are pretty small, so go for the larger size.  They are more like fast food size.  Other burgers looked a bit more decent, but on the whole, they are about average.  Pricing matches the quality of the food though.  This is a pretty solid 3 star place, meaning I'd be back but not because I was craving it.

I have always loved this place, but the last time I came here, the customer service was awful. We stood and waited (nobody else was waiting and there was hardly anybody dining there) for 10 minutes for a staff member to even come close to us. One of the girls that worked there walked past us and yelled "there's people waiting here, but I'm leaving!" to another staff member so they can come help us. It was very unprofessional and rude to not even acknowledge us - no hi how are you, sorry for the wait, or anything. Finally, another girl came up to get us seated and I let her know how unprofessional that was and how we'd been waiting. Our waitress was very friendly, but that ruined my experience here, especially since it was my friends first time here and I had been talking it up.

I was seated promptly.  Watched several members of the wait staff walk by without stopping to take my drink order. After waiting 15 minutes and turning on the call server function on the portable kiosk....I left. I can't say the customer service was bad because I wasn't given the chance to experience it.
